5501668:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 60yo female here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 23.3mm RLL nodule that was solid on CT, bronchus sign was negative, no PET done.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Fujifilm EB-580S scope with 22g needle and sampled stations 2R x4, 10R x3, 2L x2, ROSE was there and showed Malignant - NSCLC NOS at multiple stations.

then switched to Galaxy robot and navigated to the RLL medial basal (B7) lesion, registration was 1.9mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing adjacent view and did tool in lesion confirmation with radial ebus. took 5 forceps bx, 4 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Adequate lymphocytes, no malignancy.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

David Kim md
ip attending
